thread.section_title: A new presenting duo have beat Ant and Dec in a vote for the nation’s favourite double act – Metro
thread.title: A new presenting duo have beat Ant and Dec in a vote for the nation’s favourite double act
thread.title_full: A new presenting duo have beat Ant and Dec in a vote for the nation’s favourite double act

author: Rebecca Lewis
title: A new presenting duo have beat Ant and Dec in a vote for the nation’s favourite double act
text:
(Picture: ITV; Shutterstock; Metro.co.uk) The world appears to have stopped spinning because a new presenting duo appear to have finally toppled Ant and Dec.
Sir Patrick Stewart has a genius plan to fight back against President Donald Trump Yes, Ant and Dec, everyone’s favourite Geordie duo, have seemed totally unbeatable in recent years, winning 16 National Television Awards for Best TV Presenters, but it looks like there may be one double act out there that may be able to snatch the pair’s crown -their good friends, Holly Willoughby and Philip Schofield.
Yes, the This Morning duo have been named the nation’s favourite presenting duo in a poll of 9000 Radio Times readers, beating not only the Saturday Night Takeaway hosts but also Great British Bake Off’s Mel and Sue, Location Location Location’s Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer, and even This Morning’s other presenting duo, Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford.

‘Wow, what an honour’ said Holly after finding out the pair had won with 38% of the vote, compared to 18% for Ant and Dec.
‘We love the fact you love our friendship as much as we do – this award is very special.’
Speaking about the morning after the 2016 National Television Awards, when the duo presented their ITV show wearing the same outfits from the night before after partying after the ceremony, Phil joked: ‘Thank you so much and we hadn’t even had a drink.’
Ant and Dec came in at second place, while Pointless stars Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman scooped third place, followed by Mel and Sue in fourth, Ruth and Eamonn in fifth, and Good Morning Britain’s Susanna Reid and Piers Morgan in sixth place.

Kirstie and Phil were in seventh, Sunday Brunch duo Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer eighth, Strictly Come Dancing’s Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman ninth, and The One Show hosts Matt Baker and Alex Jones tenth.
The nation's favourite double acts The Top 10
1. Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby
:2. Ant and Dec
3. Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman
4. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins
5. Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford
6. Susanna Reid and Piers Morgan
7. Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer
8. Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer
9. Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman
10. Matt Baker and Alex Jones
